metadata.Title: CVE-2021-21703 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - high
metadata.Description: In PHP versions 7.3.x up to and including 7.3.31, 7.4.x below 7.4.25 and8.0.x below 8.0.12, when running PHP FPM SAPI with main FPM daemon processrunning as root and child worker processes running as lower-privilegedusers, it is possible for the child processes to access memory shared withthe main process and write to it, modifying it in a way that would causethe root process to conduct invalid memory reads and writes, which can beused to escalate privileges from local unprivileged user to the root user.

criterions.comment: php7.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
